div.div: THE PERSON BEHIND REDDIT'S 'CREEPSHOTS'

div.a: Unmasking The Biggest Troll On The Web

div.div: Michael Brustch is more than a monster. Online, Violentacrez has been one of Reddit's most reviled characters but also one of its most beloved users.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X28uEi&via=Digg&text=Unmasking The Biggest Troll On The Web

div.div: A BUNCH OF (GIF) STUFF

div.a: The Vice Presidential Debate (As Told By GIFs)

div.div: Joe Biden might have the most GIF-able smile in politics.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QnRGUy&via=Digg&text=The Vice Presidential Debate (As Told By GIFs)

div.div: ROBOT MAIDS, ROBOT TEACHERS

div.a: What The Future Looked Like To Kids In The 1970s

div.div: 1970's middle school kids predict what the year 2000 would be like.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QVYM58&via=Digg&text=What The Future Looked Like To Kids In The 1970s

div.div: DO THEY EVEN HAVE DOLPHINS IN THE UKRAINE?

div.a: Ukraine Trains Dolphins With Friggin' Pistols On Their Heads

div.div: Killer dolphins with knives and pistols attached to their heads. It might sound crazy, but that’s one element of the Ukrainian navy’s restarted marine mammal program.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OYU08K&via=Digg&text=Ukraine Trains Dolphins With Friggin' Pistols On Their Heads

div.div: SUBREDDIT ELECTORAL COLLEGE?

div.a: Why Is This Man Running For President Of The Internet?

div.div: Alexis Ohanian started Reddit, the “front page of the internet.” Then he helped kill the bill that threatened to destroy it. Now he's running for President. Of the whole thing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RlApLN&via=Digg&text=Why Is This Man Running For President Of The Internet?

div.div: 'THE INTERNET WENT OUT, SO I CAME BACK.'
War never changes. Unless you download a patch.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PtDdUU&via=Digg&text=Modern Warfare Soldier Comes Home

div.div: PROJECTS WORTH FUNDING

div.a: David Fincher Starts Kickstarter Campaign For Zombie Movie

div.div: Set in a post-apocalyptic world overrun by hobo cannibals, and evil robots, "The Goon" follows a pair of misfits as they beat down evil zombie priests and their undead hordes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QVMV77&via=Digg&text=David Fincher Starts Kickstarter Campaign For Zombie Movie

div.div: INDUSTRIALIZATION OF POP

div.a: Gangnam Style: Three Reasons K-Pop Is Taking Over The World

div.div: Yes, the video is totally crazy and awesome. But this is not some viral fluke. South Korea has been building up to this moment for 20 years.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RBvl6g&via=Digg&text=Gangnam Style: Three Reasons K-Pop Is Taking Over The World

div.style: color: #FROM HOOKERS TO DISNEY IN 12 EASY STEPS;

div.div: FROM HOOKERS TO DISNEY IN 12 EASY STEPS

div.a: The Evolution Of Times Square In Pictures

div.div: Twelve images of Times Square from 1880 to 2011: from the first neon billboards to the decline in the 80s, and finally the 90s as something more like the Vegas strip.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RlDfDu&via=Digg&text=The Evolution Of Times Square In Pictures

div.div: WORST BIRTHDAY PRESENT EVER

div.a: Birthday Girl Opens iPad From Walmart, Discovers Box Full Of Notepads

div.div: A Texas teenager celebrating her birthday opened an iPad her mother purchased at Walmart only to discover that it had been replaced with a stack of notepads.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OYMU42&via=Digg&text=Birthday Girl Opens iPad From Walmart, Discovers Box Full Of Notepads

div.div: HOW TO BE CRAZY SUCCESSFUL

div.a: What Psychopaths Teach Us About How to Succeed

div.div: Traits that are common among psychopathic serial killers are also shared by politicians and world leaders. Individuals, in other words, running not from the police. But for office.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R4WiB9&via=Digg&text=What Psychopaths Teach Us About How to Succeed

div.div: THE COMPUTER DOESN'T GUESS, IT JUST KNOWS

div.a: Meet The Algorithm That's Way Better Than You At Sudoku

div.div: Whereas most humans have to test out every possibility before filling in a square, the new algorithm just identifies patterns and fills in the correct numbers every time.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RCUY6S&via=Digg&text=Meet The Algorithm That's Way Better Than You At Sudoku

div.div: INSTAGRAM YOUR INFECTION, COMING SOON
Parents may soon be able to send their pediatrician images of their children's ear canals to determine if they have an ear infection.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RCTWrx&via=Digg&text=iPhones Can Detect Ear Infections

div.div: YOUR iPAD THINKS YOU NEED LOTION

div.a: A Touchscreen That Knows How You Feel

div.div: Touchscreens can't tell your fingers from anyone else's, but that's set to change.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OYPx5O&via=Digg&text=A Touchscreen That Knows How You Feel

div.div: SOMETHING DOESN'T ADD UP

div.a: How Do Creationists Calculate Earth’s Age, and Why Can’t They Agree?

div.div: Scientists have determined the Earth’s age is 4.5 billion years, based on molecular decay rates. How do biblical literalists come up with their estimates?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UR7kOI&via=Digg&text=How Do Creationists Calculate Earth’s Age, and Why Can’t They Agree?

div.div: WE'VE BEEN RETOUCHING SINCE 1859

div.a: Is This Shopped? Truth, Lies, And Art Before And After Photoshop

div.div: Photo manipulation been around since the beginning of the recorded image and many of its methods and motives have remained more or less the same.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TlxphV&via=Digg&text=Is This Shopped? Truth, Lies, And Art Before And After Photoshop

div.div: CLEAR EYES, FULL HEARTS, CAN'T USE

div.a: 'Friday Night Lights' Creator Accuses Mitt Romney Of Plagiarism

div.div: "Your politics and campaign are clearly not aligned with the themes we portrayed in our series," Berg writes, challenging Romney's use of "Clear Eyes. Full Hearts. Can't Lose."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UVLVyl&via=Digg&text='Friday Night Lights' Creator Accuses Mitt Romney Of Plagiarism

div.div: BRUCE WILLIS, BEN AFFLECK NOT NECESSARY

div.a: House-Sized Asteroid To Buzz Earth Today

div.div: As far as errant chunks of space rock go, this one's a tiddler -- but 2012 TC4 will come close enough to be targeted by amateur astronomers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UR6h13&via=Digg&text=House-Sized Asteroid To Buzz Earth Today

div.div: YOURS FOR THE LOW PRICE OF YOUR DIGNITY

div.a: Whoever Has The Smallest Penis In Denmark Wins A New iPhone

div.div: Because it’s Friday, and because everyone loves Denmark, there’s this: A Danish erotica site (in the fair land of Scandinavia, there is no porn, just erotica) is giving everyone something to blog about with its unorthodox new contest — whoever has the smallest penis, wins.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PstWTp&via=Digg&text=Whoever Has The Smallest Penis In Denmark Wins A New iPhone

div.div: JUST END IT?

div.a: Should Nike Be Sticking By Lance Armstrong?

div.div: The company continues to endorse Lance Armstrong. But at what cost?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TDj1a9&via=Digg&text=Should Nike Be Sticking By Lance Armstrong?

div.div: DARK SOCIAL

div.a: We Have the Whole History of the Web Wrong

div.div: The sharing you see on sites like Facebook and Twitter is the tip of the 'social' iceberg. Most sharing is done via dark social means like email and IM that are difficult to measure.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PrJSVX&via=Digg&text=We Have the Whole History of the Web Wrong
